message_1: Suppose X is a regular topological space with exactly 4 open sets. How many closed sets does X have?
message_2: In a topological space, the closed sets are the complements of the open sets. Since there are 4 open sets in X, there will also be 4 closed sets. This is because each closed set is uniquely determined by its corresponding open set (as its complement), and vice versa.
